question:
During the early medieval period there was inter-mixture of social classes as a result of which of the following factors?
1. Thousands of mixed castes were created because of the connection of Vaisya women with men of lower castes.
2. The Sudras and the untouchables got divided into countless sub-castes.
3. People also became divided into sub-castes according to the territory to which they belonged.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: During the early medieval period thousands of mixed castes were created because of the connection of Vaisya women with men of lower castes. The Sudras and the untouchables got divided into countless sub-castes. People also became divided into sub-castes according to the territory to which they belonged.
